alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 11:09PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northeast Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Ashland. In northeast Ohio, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1109 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen and additional torrential is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wooster, Ashland, Orrville, Rittman, Doylestown, Loudonville, Creston, Dalton, Shreve, West Salem, Hayesville, Savannah, Polk, Mount Eaton, Smithville, Apple Creek, Marshallville, Perrysville, Jeromesville and Fredericksburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
